intro: Koanophyllon correlliorum, commonly known as the Texas mountain-mahogany, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, while its flowers are white or pink, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Koanophyllon correlliorum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
